headlines.description: — A season of frustration continued for Liverpool and Chelsea after a 0-0 draw at Anfield on Saturday did little to help either team’s hopes of securing Champions League qualification next season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool and Chelsea draw 0-0 to hit Champions League hopes

headlines.description: Nottingham Forest's Sam Surridge fired a late equaliser to earn his side a 1-1 draw at Bournemouth on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Late goal gives Forest 1-1 draw at Bournemouth

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Leicester City

headlines.description: Teenage striker Evan Ferguson came to the rescue for Brighton by netting a late equaliser to give his side a 2-2 draw against Leicester.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brighton net late to claim 2-2 draw at Leicester

headlines.description: — Ollie Watkins’ second-half goal secured a 1-0 win for Aston Villa at Southampton in the English Premier League on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Aston Villa beats EPL bottom-dweller Southampton 1-0

headlines.description: Jarrod Bowen scored twice as West Ham beat Everton 2-0 at the London Stadium on Saturday, in a match billed as a "must-win" for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bowen brace sinks Everton in relegation scrap

headlines.description: Newcastle United extended their unbeaten Premier League run to a club record 15 matches despite being held to a 0-0 draw at Crystal Palace.
headlines.shortLinkText: Newcastle stretch unbeaten run in draw at Palace
